entry: It lives along bodies of water. Its body shape has changed to suit its habitat.

entry: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.

entry: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.

entry: It lives along bodies of water. Its body shape changed to suit its habitat.

entry: It has a pliable body without any bones. If any part of its body is torn off, it grows right back.

entry: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.

entry: They work in large colonies and make rings by linking their tails, apparently in friendship.

entry: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things, it rarely uses its hands.

entry: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.

entry: It tugs on the hands of children to steal them away. However, it gets pulled around instead.
name: drifloon

entry: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a “Signpost for Wandering Spirits.”
name: drifloon

name: drifloon

entry: These Pokémon are called the “Signpost for Wandering Spirits.” Children holding them sometimes vanish.
name: drifloon

entry: Stories go that it grabs the hands of small children and drags them away to the afterlife. It dislikes heavy children.
name: drifloon

entry: If for some reason its body bursts, its soul spills out with a screaming sound.
name: drifloon

entry: Its round body is stuffed with souls and expands each time it leads someone away.
name: drifloon

entry: Perhaps seeking company, it approaches children. However, it often quickly runs away again when the children play too roughly with it.
name: drifloon

entry: The gathering of many souls gave rise to this Pokémon. During humid seasons, they seem to appear in abundance.

entry: It tugs on the hands of children to spirit them away. However, it gets pulled around instead.

entry: It’s drowzy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.

entry: They carry people and Pokémon, but the wind can catch them, so there can’t be a fixed destination.

entry: It’s drowsy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.

name: drifblim

entry: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.

entry: Its arms and legs are weak, but when it rolls its ears up tight and then unleashes them with its full force, it can smash boulders to dust.

entry: If both of Buneary’s ears are rolled up, something is wrong with its body or mind. It’s a sure sign the Pokémon is in need of care.

entry: it can attack by rolling up their ears and then striking with the force created by unrolling them. This attack becomes stronger with training.
name: buneary

entry: An extremely cautious Pokémon. It cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.

entry: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.

entry: It sheds its fur twice a year. Its winter fur is soft and fluffy.

entry: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called “Summoner of Night.”

entry: It makes its Murkrow cronies bring it food. It idles its time away, grooming itself in its nest.

entry: It looks as if it is always crying. It is actually adjusting its body’s fluid levels by eliminating excess.

entry: It wolfs down its weight in food once a day, swallowing food whole with almost no chewing.

entry: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

name: conkeldurr

entry: Concrete mixed by it is much more durable than normal concrete, even when the compositions of the two materials are the same.
name: conkeldurr

entry: When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to pummel them with its fists.
name: conkeldurr

entry: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.
name: tympole

entry: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.
name: tympole

entry: Graceful ripples running across the water’s surface are a sure sign that it are singing in high-pitched voices below.
name: tympole

entry: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can’t hear its cries of warning.
name: tympole

entry: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.
name: palpitoad

entry: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to capture prey.
name: palpitoad

entry: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
name: palpitoad

entry: It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.
name: palpitoad

entry: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. it with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.
name: palpitoad

entry: By putting power into its bumps, it creates vibrations and increases the power of its punches.
name: seismitoad

entry: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.
name: seismitoad

entry: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.
name: seismitoad

entry: The vibrating of the bumps all over its body causes earthquake-like tremors. it and Croagunk are similar species.
name: seismitoad

entry: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.
name: seismitoad

entry: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.
name: throh

entry: When they encounter foes bigger than themselves, they try to throw them. They always travel in packs of five.
name: throh

entry: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild it use vines to weave their own belts.
name: throh

entry: It performs throwing moves with first-rate skill. Over the course of many battles, Throh’s belt grows darker as it absorbs its wearer’s sweat.
name: throh

entry: They train in groups of five. Any member that can’t keep up will discard its belt and leave the group.
name: throh

entry: Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.
name: sawk

entry: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.
name: sawk

entry: If you see a it training in the mountains in its single-minded pursuit of strength, it’s best to quietly pass by.
name: sawk

entry: The karate chops of a it that’s trained itself to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.
name: sawk

entry: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.
name: sewaddle

entry: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.
name: sewaddle

entry: Preferring dark, damp places, it spends the entire day eating fallen leaves that lie around it.
name: swadloon

entry: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.
name: swadloon

entry: Forests where it live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.
name: swadloon

entry: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.
name: leavanny

entry: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.
name: leavanny

entry: Using the feelers on its head and tail, it picks up vibrations in the air to determine its prey’s location and state.
name: venipede

entry: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.
name: venipede

entry: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.
name: venipede

entry: it and Sizzlipede are similar species, but when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.
name: venipede

entry: Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them without any thought of how things might turn out.
name: venipede

entry: Storing energy for evolution, it sits. But, when predators approach, it moves to stab them with poison spikes.
name: whirlipede

entry: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.
name: whirlipede

entry: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
name: whirlipede

entry: This Pokémon spins itself rapidly and charges into its opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.
name: whirlipede

entry: it protects itself with a sturdy shell and poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll need for evolution.
name: whirlipede

entry: It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it stops moving. Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.
name: scolipede

entry: Highly aggressive, it uses the claws near its neck to dig into its opponents and poison them.
name: scolipede

entry: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.
name: scolipede

entry: it latches on to its prey with the claws on its neck before slamming them into the ground and jabbing them with its claws’ toxic spikes.
name: scolipede

entry: it engage in fierce territorial battles with Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles, the victor makes a meal of the loser.
name: scolipede

entry: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.
name: cottonee

entry: They go wherever the wind takes them. On rainy days, their bodies are heavier, so they take shelter beneath big trees.
name: cottonee

entry: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
name: cottonee

entry: When it finds others of its kind, they all stick together. When enough of them have collected, the mass resembles a cumulonimbus cloud.
name: cottonee

entry: Pillows and beds stuffed with cotton exhaled by it are soft and puffy, light and airy— altogether top quality.
name: cottonee

entry: To protect itself, it shoots cotton from its body. When it gets wet in the rain, its cotton grows moist and heavy, and it can’t move as well.
name: cottonee

entry: It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.
name: cottonee

entry: Weaving together the cotton of both it and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s highly prized by many luxury brands.
name: cottonee

entry: They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls of cotton in homes.
name: whimsicott

entry: Riding whirlwinds, they appear. These Pokémon sneak through gaps into houses and cause all sorts of mischief.
name: whimsicott

entry: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.
name: whimsicott

entry: It rides on the wind and slips into people’s homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton-filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.
name: whimsicott

entry: This Pokémon appears, riding upon the wind. But if the wind gusts up, it’ll blow the cotton on this Pokémon’s head clean off.
name: whimsicott

entry: This nuisance sneaks into people’s homes, where it hides important things and scatters cotton all over the place.
name: whimsicott

entry: It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, it’ll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.
name: whimsicott

entry: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, it tears it off and scatters it.
name: whimsicott

entry: The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.
name: petilil

entry: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where it live are known to be good for growing plants.
name: petilil

entry: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
name: petilil

entry: Although the leaves on its head are bitter enough to cause dizziness, they provide relief from weariness—even more so when boiled.
name: petilil

entry: By pruning the leaves on its head with regularity, this Pokémon can be grown into a fine plump shape.
name: petilil

entry: Some say if you dry the leaves on its head, boil them down, and drink the infusion, your vigor will return, so it is popular with the elderly.
name: petilil

entry: it appears around sources of clean water. Boiling leaves from this Pokémon’s head results in a liquid that’s sometimes used as a bug repellent.
name: petilil

entry: The deeper the color of a Petilil’s leaves, the healthier the Pokémon is. it sometimes makes its home in a well-tended field or flowerbed.
name: petilil

entry: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect, but taking care of it is very difficult.
name: lilligant

entry: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect. It withers if a Trainer does not take good care of it.
name: lilligant

entry: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.
name: lilligant

entry: No matter how much time and money is spent raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful when they bloom in the wild.
name: lilligant

entry: As soon as it finds a male to be its partner, the beautiful flower on its head darkens, droops, and withers away.
name: lilligant

entry: The fragrance of its flower differs slightly depending on the soil where it grew up. Sniffing the aroma calms your heart and mind.
name: lilligant

entry: It’s believed that even first-rate gardeners have a hard time getting the flower on a Lilligant’s head to bloom.
name: lilligant

entry: Essential oils made from it flowers have a sublime scent, but they’re also staggeringly expensive.
name: lilligant

entry: and blue it usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other’s school.
name: basculin

entry: Red- and blue-striped it are very violent and always fighting. They are also remarkably tasty.
name: basculin

entry: They live hidden under hot desert sands in order to keep their body temperature from dropping.
name: sandile

entry: It moves along below the sand’s surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.
name: sandile

entry: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.
name: sandile

entry: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.
name: sandile

entry: It conceals itself in the sand and chomps down on the legs of any prey that unwarily walk over it. Its favorite food is Trapinch.
name: sandile

entry: Alola, where it’s warm all year round, is a comfortable environment for this Pokémon. Sometimes you’ll even see it outside of deserts.
name: sandile

entry: The desert gets cold at night, so when the sun sets, this Pokémon burrows deep into the sand and sleeps until sunrise.
name: sandile

entry: it is small, but its legs and lower body are powerful. Pushing sand aside as it goes, it moves through the desert as if it’s swimming.
name: sandile

entry: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.
name: krokorok

entry: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.
name: krokorok

entry: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
name: krokorok

entry: They move in groups of a few individuals. A female is often the leader of the group, and the males will gather food.
name: krokorok

entry: Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.
name: krokorok

entry: it really hates it when its body gets cold. On nights when the temperature drops, it digs deep into the desert sands.
name: krokorok

entry: it has specialized eyes that enable it to see in the dark. This ability lets it hunt in the dead of night without getting lost.
name: krokorok

entry: Although this Pokémon has specialized eyes that allow it to see in the dark, it won’t move much at night—the desert gets cold after sunset.
name: krokorok

entry: Very violent Pokémon, they try to clamp down on anything that moves in front of their eyes.
name: krookodile

entry: It can expand the focus of its eyes, enabling it to see objects in the far distance as if it were using binoculars.
name: krookodile

entry: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.
name: krookodile

entry: Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of a sandstorm.
name: krookodile

entry: After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it twists its body around to rip its prey in half.
name: krookodile

entry: When it spots prey, even at a distance of over 30 miles, it swims through the desert as if it were water, then jumps out and chomps them.
name: krookodile

entry: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sands. Krookodile’s mighty jaws can bite through heavy plates of iron with almost no effort at all.
name: krookodile

entry: While terribly aggressive, it also has the patience to stay hidden under sand for days, lying in wait for prey.
name: krookodile

entry: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100° F.
name: darumaka

entry: Darumaka’s droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.
name: darumaka

entry: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.
name: darumaka

entry: It derives its power from fire burning inside its body. If the fire dwindles, this Pokémon will immediately fall asleep.
name: darumaka

entry: This popular symbol of good fortune will never fall over in its sleep, no matter how it’s pushed or pulled.
name: darumaka

entry: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.
name: darmanitan

entry: When weakened in battle, it transforms into a stone statue. Then it sharpens its mind and fights on mentally.
name: darmanitan

entry: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.
name: darmanitan

entry: When it moves rhythmically, it makes a sound similar to maracas, making the surprised Pokémon flee.
name: maractus

entry: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.
name: maractus

entry: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.
name: maractus

entry: With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling bird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.
name: maractus

entry: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.
name: maractus

entry: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.
name: dwebble

entry: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.
name: dwebble

entry: When it finds a stone appealing, it creates a hole inside it and uses it as its home. This Pokémon is the natural enemy of Roggenrola and Rolycoly.
name: dwebble

entry: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, it may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.
name: dwebble

entry: When its boulder is broken in battles for territory, it feels unsure and begins to weaken.
name: crustle

entry: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.
name: crustle

entry: Competing for territory, it fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.
name: crustle

entry: This highly territorial Pokémon prefers dry climates. It won’t come out of its boulder on rainy days.
name: crustle

entry: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They’re mighty enough to crack Rhyperior’s carapace.
name: crustle

entry: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.
name: scraggy

entry: It immediately headbutts anyone that makes eye contact with it. Its skull is massively thick.
name: scraggy

entry: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.
name: scraggy

entry: They move in small groups, walking around lazily. Anyone who makes eye contact gets smacked with a headbutt.
name: scraggy

entry: If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this troublesome Pokémon.
name: scraggy

entry: It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.
name: scraggy

entry: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.
name: scrafty

entry: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.
name: scrafty

entry: This Pokémon may be rude, but it takes very good care of its family, its friends, and its turf.
name: scrafty

entry: As halfhearted as this Pokémon’s kicks may seem, they pack enough power to shatter Conkeldurr’s concrete pillars.
name: scrafty

entry: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.
name: scrafty

entry: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.
name: sigilyph

entry: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.
name: sigilyph

entry: Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some say they were the guardians of an ancient city. Others say they were the guardians’ emissaries.
name: sigilyph

entry: A discovery was made in the desert where it fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.
name: sigilyph

entry: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.
name: yamask

entry: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves in past ages. Each retains memories of its former life.
name: yamask

entry: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.
name: yamask

entry: It wanders through ruins by night, carrying a mask that’s said to have been the face it had when it was still human.
name: yamask

entry: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.
name: yamask

entry: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.
name: cofagrigus

entry: They pretend to be elaborate coffins to teach lessons to grave robbers. Their bodies are covered in pure gold.
name: cofagrigus

entry: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.
name: cofagrigus

entry: This Pokémon has a body of sparkling gold. People say it no longer remembers that it was once human.
name: cofagrigus

entry: There are many depictions of it decorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.
name: cofagrigus

entry: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. It swam skillfully and dove to depths beyond half a mile.
name: tirtouga

entry: About 100 million years ago, these Pokémon swam in oceans. It is thought they also went on land to attack prey.
name: tirtouga

entry: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.
name: tirtouga

entry: Based on studies of its skeletal structure, it can apparently dive to ocean depths of over half a mile.
name: tirtouga

entry: Reputed to be the ancestor of most turtle Pokémon, it lived in warm seas approximately a hundred million years ago.
name: tirtouga

entry: It was restored from an ancient fossil. it lived in the sea but came up onto the land to search for prey.
name: tirtouga

entry: This Pokémon inhabited ancient seas. Although it can only crawl, it still comes up onto land in search of prey.
name: tirtouga

entry: it is considered to be the ancestor of many turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life from a fossil.
name: tirtouga

entry: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.
name: carracosta

entry: Incredible jaw strength enables them to chew up steel beams and rocks along with their prey.
name: carracosta

entry: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
name: carracosta

entry: It constructed its sturdy shell by crunching and swallowing the hard shells or bones of its prey.
name: carracosta

entry: Active both on land and in the sea, this Pokémon drags its land-based prey into the water to finish it off.
name: carracosta

entry: Its jaws are terrifyingly powerful. It could eat Omastar and Omanyte whole and not be bothered in the slightest by their shells.
name: carracosta

entry: it completely devours its prey—bones, shells, and all. Because of this, Carracosta’s own shell grows thick and sturdy.
name: carracosta

entry: This Pokémon emerges from the water in search of prey despite the fact that it moves more slowly on land.
name: carracosta

entry: It was revived from an ancient fossil. Not able to fly, it lived in treetops and hopped from one branch to another.
name: archen

entry: Revived from a fossil, this Pokémon is thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon.
name: archen

entry: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.
name: archen

entry: It is the ancestor of all bird Pokémon. it itself could not actually fly but moved by hopping from treetop to treetop.
name: archen

entry: To all appearances flightless, it was able to glide down from tall treetops to snag its prey.
name: archen

entry: Once thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon, some of the latest research suggests that may not be the case.
name: archen

entry: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. As research suggested, it is unable to fly. But it’s very good at jumping.
name: archen

entry: it is said to be the ancestor of bird Pokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries and bug Pokémon.
name: archen

entry: It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky by running at a speed of 25 mph.
name: archeops

entry: It runs better than it flies. It catches prey by running at speeds comparable to those of an automobile.
name: archeops

entry: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.
name: archeops

entry: Although apparently able to fly, they tended to run along the ground, averaging speeds of roughly 25 mph.
name: archeops

entry: They hunted in flocks. When one it had the prey cornered, another would swoop on it.
name: archeops

entry: This ancient Pokémon’s plumage is delicate, so if anyone other than an experienced professional tries to restore it, they will fail.
name: archeops

entry: It needs a running start to take off. If it wants to fly, it first needs to run nearly 25 mph, building speed over a course of about 2.5 miles.
name: archeops

entry: Though capable of flight, it was apparently better at hunting on the ground.
name: archeops

entry: Wanting more garbage, they follow people who litter. They always belch poison gas.
name: trubbish

entry: The combination of garbage bags and industrial waste caused the chemical reaction that created this Pokémon.
name: trubbish

entry: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.
name: trubbish

entry: Unsanitary places are what they like best. They can be spotted in Alola, often with Grimer in hot pursuit.
name: trubbish

entry: It gorges on trash until its stomach is full. Then it belches toxic gas. An unlucky whiff of gas will put a person in the hospital.
name: trubbish

entry: Poisonous gas leaks out of it when it breathes. Muk that catch a whiff of that stench will come drooling.
name: trubbish

entry: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.
name: trubbish

entry: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.
name: trubbish

entry: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.
name: garbodor

entry: They absorb garbage and make it part of their bodies. They shoot a poisonous liquid from their right-hand fingertips.
name: garbodor

entry: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.
name: garbodor

entry: Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots from its right arm. If even a little of it gets on you, you’ll experience the effects of the unidentified toxin.
name: garbodor

entry: For a time, their numbers increased explosively in Alola. Since the arrival of Grimer, their population has decreased dramatically.
name: garbodor

entry: It locks opponents in place with its left hand, immobilizing them by entirely dousing their bodies with poisonous liquid.
name: garbodor

entry: This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.
name: garbodor

entry: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.
name: garbodor

entry: It changes so it looks just like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.
name: zorua

entry: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.
name: zorua

entry: This Pokémon has a cowardly disposition, so when it’s not around friends, it basically always stays transformed as something else.
name: zorua

entry: it is a timid Pokémon. This disposition seems to be what led to the development of Zorua’s ability to take on the forms of other creatures.
name: zorua

entry: it sometimes transforms into a person and goes into cities to search for food. When it does this, it usually takes on the form of a child.
name: zorua

entry: Stories say those who tried to catch it were trapped in an illusion and punished.
name: zoroark

entry: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.
name: zoroark

entry: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.
name: zoroark

entry: It doesn’t just transform itself—it also has the power to make hundreds of people see its illusions.
name: zoroark

entry: This Pokémon cares deeply about others of its kind, and it will conjure terrifying illusions to keep its den and pack safe.
name: zoroark

entry: Seeking to ease the burden of their solitude, lonely Trainers tell it to show illusions to them.
name: zoroark

entry: it greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.
name: minccino

entry: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.
name: minccino

entry: A clean freak that will not allow even the slightest mess, it uses its tail like a mop to thoroughly clean any and all filth.
name: minccino

entry: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.
name: minccino

entry: They pet each other with their tails as a form of greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier is a bit more boastful.
name: minccino

entry: Cinccino’s body is coated in a special oil that helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.
name: cinccino

entry: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.
name: cinccino

entry: The white parts of its coat are covered in an oil secreted from its body, so this Pokémon can slide right away from its enemies’ attacks.
name: cinccino

entry: Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. it won’t tolerate even a speck of the stuff.
name: cinccino

entry: A special oil that seeps through their fur helps them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price at market.
name: cinccino

entry: It stares intently at everything. It can become so obsessed with watching that it doesn’t notice attacks.
name: gothita

entry: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only it can see.
name: gothita

entry: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.

entry: Though they’re still only babies, there’s psychic power stored in their ribbonlike feelers, and sometimes they use that power to fight.
name: gothita

entry: Even when nobody seems to be around, it can still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe it’s speaking to something only it can see.

name: gothorita

entry: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.

entry: It’s said that when stars shine in the night sky, this Pokémon will spirit away sleeping children. Some call it the Witch of Punishment.
name: gothorita

entry: On nights when the stars shine, this Pokémon’s psychic power is at its strongest. It’s unknown just what link it has to the greater universe.
name: gothorita

entry: It can see the future from the movement of the stars. When it learns its Trainer’s life span, it cries in sadness.
name: gothitelle

entry: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers’ life spans.
name: gothitelle

entry: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.
name: gothitelle

entry: It has tremendous psychic power, but it dislikes conflict. It’s also able to predict the future based on the movement of the stars.
name: gothitelle

entry: A criminal who was shown his fate by a it went missing that same day and was never seen again.
name: gothitelle

entry: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they are fine in any environment, no matter how severe.
name: solosis

entry: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they can survive in any environment.
name: solosis

entry: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.
name: solosis

entry: It communicates with others telepathically. Its body is encapsulated in liquid, but if it takes a heavy blow, the liquid will leak out.
name: solosis

entry: Many say that the special liquid covering this Pokémon’s body would allow it to survive in the vacuum of space.
name: solosis

entry: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.
name: duosion

entry: When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thoughts, these Pokémon exhibit their maximum power.
name: duosion

entry: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.
name: duosion

entry: Its psychic power can supposedly cover a range of more than half a mile—but only if its two brains can agree with each other.
name: duosion

entry: Its brain has split into two, and the two halves rarely think alike. Its actions are utterly unpredictable.
name: duosion

entry: They use psychic power to control their arms, which are made of a special liquid. They can crush boulders psychically.
name: reuniclus

entry: These remarkably intelligent Pokémon fight by controlling arms that can grip with rock-crushing power.

entry: When it shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.

entry: While it could use its psychic abilities in battle, this Pokémon prefers to swing its powerful arms around to beat opponents into submission.

entry: It’s said that drinking the liquid surrounding it grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is highly toxic to anything besides it itself.
name: reuniclus

entry: Theoretically, this Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. Their breath is -58° F.
name: vanillite

entry: This Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.
name: vanillite

name: vanillite

entry: It feels pleasantly cool when embraced. This Pokémon is treasured by households in warm regions.

name: vanillite

entry: Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.
name: vanillite

entry: They cool down the surrounding air and create ice particles, which they use to freeze their foes.
name: vanillish

entry: It conceals itself from enemy eyes by creating many small ice particles and hiding among them.
name: vanillish

name: vanillish

entry: Hot days cause its body to melt. It can be restored by refreezing it, but the process leaves its body slightly warped.
name: vanillish

name: vanillish

entry: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.

name: vanilluxe

entry: It glides on its outstretched membrane while shocking foes with the electricity stored in the pouches on its cheeks.

name: foongus

name: foongus

name: foongus

entry: When its body dries out, it weakens. So it wraps a membrane around itself for protection while it spits poison.

entry: It moves with blinding speed and lobs poison at foes. Featuring it as a main character is a surefire way to make a movie or comic popular.

entry: It takes pride in the speed at which it can use moves. What it loses in power, it makes up for in quantity.

entry: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It’s been active for thousands of years.

entry: These Pokémon are thought to have been created by the science of an ancient and mysterious civilization.

entry: It is said that it were ordered to protect people and Pokémon by the ancient people who made them.

entry: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.
name: golurk

entry: Some say that ancient people invented it to serve as a laborer. It follows its master’s orders faithfully.
name: golurk

entry: Artillery platforms built into the walls of ancient castles served as perches from which it could fire energy beams.
name: golurk

entry: There’s a theory that inside it is a perpetual motion machine that produces limitless energy, but this belief hasn’t been proven.
name: golurk

entry: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.
name: pawniard

entry: They fight at Bisharp’s command. They cling to their prey and inflict damage by sinking their blades into it.
name: pawniard

entry: Blades comprise this Pokémon’s entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.
name: pawniard

entry: After shredding its prey, it sharpens its blades on a stone by the river. Each it has its own favorite sharpening stone.
name: pawniard

entry: It uses river stones to maintain the cutting edges of the blades covering its body. These sharpened blades allow it to bring down opponents.
name: pawniard

entry: A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a Bisharp boss. Each it trains diligently, dreaming of one day taking the lead.
name: pawniard

entry: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.
name: bisharp

entry: it pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then it finishes off the prey.
name: bisharp

entry: No matter how strong the Bisharp, it’s said that if the blade on its head is chipped, it will retire from its position as the boss.
name: bisharp

entry: It’s accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard. it keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring none of them even think of double-crossing it.
name: bisharp

entry: Violent conflicts erupt between it and Fraxure over places where sharpening stones can be found.
name: bisharp

entry: They are known to charge so wildly that if a train were to enter their territory, they would send it flying.
name: bouffalant

entry: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.
name: bouffalant

entry: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.
name: bouffalant

entry: These Pokémon can crush a car with no more than a headbutt. it with more hair on their heads hold higher positions within the herd.
name: bouffalant

entry: These Pokémon live in herds of about 20 individuals. it that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.
name: bouffalant

entry: It stands up to massive opponents, not out of courage, but out of recklessness. But that is how it gets stronger.
name: rufflet

entry: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.
name: rufflet

entry: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.
name: rufflet

entry: They pick fights indiscriminately. They grow stronger and more powerful each time they faint or are injured.
name: rufflet

entry: With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces its prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also consumes berries, it’s a carnivore at heart.
name: rufflet

entry: With its powerful legs and sturdy claws, it can crack even the hard shells of Shellder and pluck out their insides.
name: rufflet

entry: If it spies a strong Pokémon, it can’t resist challenging it to a battle. But if it loses, it starts bawling.
name: rufflet

entry: A combative Pokémon, it’s ready to pick a fight with anyone. It has talons that can crush hard berries.
name: rufflet

entry: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.
name: braviary

entry: The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.
name: braviary

entry: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.
name: braviary

entry: With its brave disposition, it fears nothing—not even death. Ancient Alolan people respected it, referring to it as “the hero of the sky.”
name: braviary

entry: It’s thought that people disturbed their habitats in the past, so it banded together to fight back.
name: braviary

entry: The more scars it has on its front, the more heroic it’s considered to be. Those with many scars on their back are mocked by the flock.
name: braviary

entry: Known for its bravery and pride, this majestic Pokémon is often seen as a motif for various kinds of emblems.
name: braviary

entry: Because this Pokémon is hotheaded and belligerent, it’s Corviknight that’s taken the role of transportation in Galar.
name: braviary

entry: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.
name: vullaby

entry: They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokémon.
name: vullaby

entry: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.
name: vullaby

entry: It protects its plump posterior with the bones of prey it has consumed. As it grows, it replaces the bones.
name: vullaby

entry: It can’t fly yet and must wait until its wings have developed more. Since it’s still at a playful age, it hops around friskily.
name: vullaby

entry: Mandibuzz gives it the bones it wears. Vullaby’s wings are short, so it can’t fly yet, but it jumps around, dreaming of wide open skies.
name: vullaby

entry: It wears a bone to protect its rear. It often squabbles with others of its kind over particularly comfy bones.
name: vullaby

entry: it grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older it to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.
name: vullaby

entry: They fly in circles around the sky. When they spot prey, they attack and carry it back to their nest with ease.
name: mandibuzz

entry: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.
name: mandibuzz

entry: They adorn themselves beautifully with bones. This is supposedly an effort to attract males, but no male it have ever been found.
name: mandibuzz

entry: It circles in the sky, keeping a keen eye out for Pokémon in a weakened state. Its choicest food is Cubone.
name: mandibuzz

entry: It skillfully arranges the bones of its prey to construct its nest. Most of the bones are Cubone.
name: mandibuzz

entry: Although it’s a bit of a ruffian, this Pokémon will take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them till they’re ready to leave the nest.
name: mandibuzz

entry: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.
name: mandibuzz

entry: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.
name: heatmor

entry: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant’s steel bodies and consume their insides.
name: heatmor

entry: There’s a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.
name: heatmor

entry: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that it can devour their insides.
name: heatmor

entry: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.
name: durant

entry: it dig nests in mountains. They build their complicated, interconnected tunnels into mazes.
name: durant

entry: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.
name: durant

entry: They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.
name: durant

entry: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.
name: durant

entry: Lacking sight, it’s unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.
name: deino

entry: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.
name: deino

entry: When it encounters something, its first urge is usually to bite it. If it likes what it tastes, it will commit the associated scent to memory.
name: deino

entry: Because it can’t see, this Pokémon is constantly biting at everything it touches, trying to keep track of its surroundings.
name: deino

entry: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
name: zweilous

entry: Since their two heads do not get along and compete with each other for food, they always eat too much.
name: zweilous

entry: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.
name: zweilous

entry: While hunting for prey, it wanders its territory, its two heads often bickering over which way to go.
name: zweilous

entry: Their two heads will fight each other over a single piece of food. it are covered in scars even without battling others.
name: zweilous

entry: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!
name: hydreigon

entry: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
name: hydreigon

entry: There are a slew of stories about villages that were destroyed by Hydreigon. It bites anything that moves.
name: hydreigon

entry: The three heads take turns sinking their teeth into the opponent. Their attacks won’t slow until their target goes down.
name: hydreigon

entry: Said to have been born from the sun, it spews fire from its horns and encases itself in a cocoon of fire when it evolves.
name: larvesta

entry: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.
name: larvesta

entry: When battling opponents, it sprays fire from its five horns. The max temperature of the flames can reach nearly 5,500 degrees Fahrenheit.
name: larvesta

entry: The people of ancient times believed that it fell from the sun.
name: larvesta

entry: Larvesta’s body is warm all over. It spouts fire from the tips of its horns to intimidate predators and scare prey.
name: larvesta

entry: Thought to be an embodiment of the sun, it appeared during a bitterly cold winter and saved Pokémon from freezing.
name: volcarona

entry: A sea of fire engulfs the surroundings of their battles, since they use their six wings to scatter their ember scales.
name: volcarona

entry: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona’s fire provided a replacement for the sun.
name: volcarona

entry: As it flies, it scatters its flaming scales. It was feared by ancient people, who referred to it as “the rage of the sun.”
name: volcarona

entry: it scatters burning scales. Some say it does this to start fires. Others say it’s trying to rescue those that suffer in the cold.
name: volcarona

entry: This Pokémon emerges from a cocoon formed of raging flames. Ancient murals depict it as a deity of fire.
name: volcarona

entry: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.
name: cobalion

entry: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.
name: cobalion

entry: This Pokémon appears in a legend alongside Terrakion and Virizion, fighting against humans in defense of the Unova region’s Pokémon.
name: cobalion

entry: From the moment it’s born, this Pokémon radiates the air of a leader. Its presence will calm even vicious foes.
name: cobalion

entry: Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémon.
name: terrakion

entry: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokémon is spoken of in legends.
name: terrakion

entry: It has phenomenal power. It will mercilessly crush anyone or anything that bullies small Pokémon.
name: terrakion

entry: In Unovan legend, it battled against humans in an effort to protect other Pokémon.
name: terrakion

entry: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.
name: virizion

entry: Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Using whirlwind-like movements, it confounds and swiftly cuts opponents.
name: virizion

entry: A legend tells of this Pokémon working together with Cobalion and Terrakion to protect the Pokémon of the Unova region.
name: virizion

entry: It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick movements, slicing them up with its horns.
name: virizion

entry: In every direction it flies, creating winds so powerful, they blow everything away.
name: tornadus

entry: it expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.
name: tornadus

entry: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.
name: tornadus

entry: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.
name: thundurus

entry: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.
name: thundurus

entry: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.
name: reshiram

entry: When Reshiram’s tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world’s weather.
name: reshiram

entry: Flames spew from its tail as it flies through the sky like a jet airplane. It’s said that this Pokémon will scorch the world.
name: reshiram

entry: According to myth, if people ignore truth and let themselves become consumed by greed, it will arrive to burn their kingdoms down.
name: reshiram

entry: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.
name: zekrom

entry: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.
name: zekrom

entry: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.
name: zekrom

entry: When the interior part of its tail spins like a motor, it can generate many bolts of lightning to blast its surroundings.
name: zekrom

entry: Mythology tells us that if people lose the righteousness in their hearts, their kingdoms will be razed by Zekrom’s lightning.
name: zekrom

entry: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.

entry: The energy that comes pouring from its tail increases the nutrition in the soil, making crops grow to great size.
name: landorus

entry: Lands visited by it grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”
name: landorus

entry: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.
name: kyurem

entry: It can produce ultracold air. Its body is frozen.

entry: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.
name: kyurem

entry: Dwelling within it is a power even greater than that of Reshiram or Zekrom, but the extreme cold keeps that power bound.
name: kyurem

entry: It appears that this Pokémon uses its powers over ice to freeze its own body in order to stabilize its cellular structure.
name: kyurem

entry: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

entry: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.
name: keldeo

entry: The melodies sung by it have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.
name: meloetta

entry: Many famous songs have been inspired by the melodies that it plays.
name: meloetta

entry: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
name: meloetta

entry: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
name: genesect

entry: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.
name: genesect

entry: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.
name: chespin

entry: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.
name: chespin

entry: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.

entry: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.

entry: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

entry: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.

entry: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

entry: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

entry: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.
name: frogadier

name: greninja

entry: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.
name: greninja

entry: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.
name: bunnelby

entry: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.
