name: bunnelby

entry: It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight’s flapping will have it digging a hole to hide underground in moments.
name: bunnelby

entry: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.
name: diggersby

entry: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it’s finished digging, it lounges lazily.
name: diggersby

entry: With power equal to an excavator, it can dig through dense bedrock. It’s a huge help during tunnel construction.
name: diggersby

entry: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.
name: diggersby

entry: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.
name: fletchling

entry: Despite the beauty of its lilting voice, it’s merciless to intruders that enter its territory.
name: fletchling

entry: This amiable Pokémon is easy to train. But when battle is joined, it shows its ferocious side.
name: fletchling

entry: When it’s excited, its temperature can double, spiking hormone production in its body.
name: fletchling

entry: While it’s an amiable Pokémon, if you touch it unexpectedly, it will heat up its body in an instant, and you’ll be burned.
name: fletchling

entry: Its melodious cries are actually warnings. it will mercilessly peck at anything that enters its territory.
name: fletchling

entry: When this Pokémon gets excited, its body temperature increases sharply. If you touch a it with bare hands, you might get burned.
name: fletchling

entry: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.
name: fletchinder

entry: The hotter the flame sac on its belly, the faster it can fly, but it takes some time to get the fire going.
name: fletchinder

entry: From its beak, it fires embers at its prey. Once it has caught them, it grills them at high heat before feasting upon them.
name: fletchinder

entry: It will not tolerate other it entering its territory, which has a radius of several miles.
name: fletchinder

entry: It scatters embers in the tall grass. Then bug Pokémon, frightened by the flames, come flying out, and it gobbles them up.
name: fletchinder

entry: it launches embers into the den of its prey. When the prey comes leaping out, Fletchinder’s sharp talons finish it off.
name: fletchinder

entry: it are exceedingly territorial and aggressive. These Pokémon fight among themselves over feeding grounds.
name: fletchinder

entry: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.
name: talonflame

entry: When attacking prey, it can reach speeds of up to 310 mph. It finishes its prey off with a colossal kick.
name: talonflame

entry: Its favorite foods are Wingull and Pikipek. It attacks with a powerful kick and grasps them firmly in its talons.
name: talonflame

entry: It zooms directly at its prey at flight speeds of close to 310 mph, while fiery embers scatter from gaps in its feathers.
name: talonflame

entry: Its tough wings don’t allow fire to pass through them. A long time ago, firefighters’ outfits were made from it wings.
name: talonflame

entry: it mainly preys upon other bird Pokémon. To intimidate opponents, it sends embers spewing from gaps between its feathers.
name: talonflame

entry: it dives toward prey at speeds of up to 310 mph and assaults them with powerful kicks, giving the prey no chance to escape.
name: talonflame

entry: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.
name: scatterbug

entry: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.
name: scatterbug

entry: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.
name: spewpa

entry: The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.
name: spewpa

entry: it with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
name: vivillon

entry: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.
name: vivillon

entry: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.
name: litleo

entry: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.
name: litleo

entry: When they’re young, they live with a pride. Once they’re able to hunt prey on their own, they’re kicked out and have to make their own way.
name: litleo

entry: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.
name: pyroar

entry: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride’s cubs.
name: pyroar

entry: The males are usually lazy, but when attacked by a strong foe, a male will protect its friends with no regard for its own safety.
name: pyroar

entry: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.
name: flabebe

entry: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind’s embrace with an untroubled heart.
name: flabebe

entry: It’s not safe without the power of a flower, but it will keep traveling around until it finds one with the color and shape it wants.
name: flabebe

entry: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.
name: floette

entry: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.
name: floette

entry: It raises flowers and uses them as weapons. The more gorgeous the blossom, the more power it contains.
name: floette

entry: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.
name: florges

entry: In times long past, governors of castles would invite it to create flower gardens to embellish the castle domains.
name: florges

entry: It controls the flowers it grows. The petal blizzards that it triggers are overwhelming in their beauty and power.
name: florges

entry: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.
name: skiddo

entry: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.
name: skiddo

entry: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.
name: gogoat

entry: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.
name: gogoat

entry: It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies, but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating. Chewing on a leaf is its trademark.
name: pancham

entry: It does its level best to glare and pull a scary face, but it can’t help grinning if anyone pats its head.
name: pancham

entry: It grows up imitating the behavior of Pangoro, which it looks up to as a leader.
name: pancham

entry: There’s no point to the leaf in its mouth, aside from an effort to look cool. It’s mischievous, so it’s not well suited to inexperienced Trainers.
name: pancham

entry: It follows Pangoro around like a henchman. When it makes a big mistake, its leaf gets taken away.
name: pancham

entry: It chooses a Pangoro as its master and then imitates its master’s actions. This is how it learns to battle and hunt for prey.
name: pancham

entry: Wanting to make sure it’s taken seriously, Pancham’s always giving others a glare. But if it’s not focusing, it ends up smiling.
name: pancham

entry: Although it possesses a violent temperament, it won’t put up with bullying. It uses the leaf in its mouth to sense the movements of its enemies.
name: pangoro

entry: It charges ahead and bashes its opponents like a berserker, uncaring about any hits it might take. Its arms are mighty enough to snap a telephone pole.
name: pangoro

entry: It boasts superb physical strength. Those who wish to become Pangoro’s Trainer have no choice but to converse with their fists.
name: pangoro

entry: From the slight twitches of its bamboo leaf, it deduces its opponent’s movements. It’s eager to tussle but kindhearted toward its companions.
name: pangoro

entry: This rowdy Pokémon boasts great physical strength. Many Trainers are also smitten by its lively character.
name: pangoro

entry: This Pokémon is quick to anger, and it has no problem using its prodigious strength to get its way. It lives for duels against Obstagoon.
name: pangoro

entry: Using its leaf, it can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.
name: pangoro

entry: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.
name: furfrou

entry: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokémon were the designated guardians of the king.
name: furfrou

entry: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou’s fur into the most exquisite style.
name: furfrou

entry: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.
name: espurr

entry: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.
name: espurr

entry: Though Espurr’s expression never changes, behind that blank stare is an intense struggle to contain its devastating psychic power.
name: espurr

entry: There’s enough psychic power in it to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can’t be controlled, it finds it troublesome.
name: espurr

entry: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.
name: meowstic

entry: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.
name: meowstic

entry: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.
name: honedge

entry: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person’s arm and drains that person’s life energy completely.
name: honedge

entry: Honedge’s soul once belonged to a person who was killed a long time ago by the sword that makes up Honedge’s body.
name: honedge

entry: The blue eye on the sword’s handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people’s lives away.
name: honedge

entry: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.
name: doublade

entry: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.
name: doublade

entry: Honedge evolves into twins. The two blades rub together to emit a metallic sound that unnerves opponents.
name: doublade

entry: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.
name: doublade

entry: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.
name: aegislash

entry: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.
name: aegislash

entry: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.
name: spritzee

entry: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a it that would waft a fragrance they liked.
name: spritzee

entry: A scent pouch within this Pokémon’s body allows it to create various scents. A change in its diet will alter the fragrance it produces.
name: spritzee

entry: The scent its body gives off enraptures those who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of love for Spritzee.
name: spritzee

entry: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.
name: aromatisse

entry: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.
name: aromatisse

entry: The scent that constantly emits from its fur is so powerful that this Pokémon’s companions will eventually lose their sense of smell.
name: aromatisse

entry: The scents it can produce range from sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells that sap an opponent’s will to fight.
name: aromatisse

entry: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.
name: swirlix

entry: Because it eats nothing but sweets, its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.
name: swirlix

entry: It eats its own weight in sugar every day. If it doesn’t get enough sugar, it becomes incredibly grumpy.
name: swirlix

entry: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.
name: swirlix

entry: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.
name: slurpuff

entry: Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than a human’s, so even the faintest scent tells it about everything in the area. It’s like it can see with its nose!
name: slurpuff

entry: By taking in a person’s scent, it can sniff out their mental and physical condition. It’s hoped that this skill will have many medical applications.
name: slurpuff

entry: Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.
name: slurpuff

entry: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.
name: inkay

entry: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent’s will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.
name: inkay

entry: It draws prey near with its blinking lights and then wraps them up in its long tentacles and holds them in place.
name: inkay

entry: It spins while making its luminescent spots flash. These spots allow it to communicate with others by using different patterns of light.
name: inkay

entry: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, it demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.
name: inkay

entry: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.
name: malamar

entry: It lures its prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.
name: malamar

entry: When it comes to strong hypnosis, there’s an endless number of people who utilize it for their nefarious deeds.
name: malamar

entry: Gazing at its luminescent spots will quickly induce a hypnotic state, putting the observer under Malamar’s control.
name: malamar

entry: It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.
name: malamar

entry: Two it live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.
name: binacle

entry: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.
name: binacle

entry: After two it find a suitably sized rock, they adhere themselves to it and live together. They cooperate to gather food during high tide.
name: binacle

entry: If the two don’t work well together, both their offense and defense fall apart. Without good teamwork, they won’t survive.
name: binacle

entry: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.
name: barbaracle

entry: Barbaracle’s legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head’s orders.
name: barbaracle

entry: Seven Binacle come together to form one Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head gives orders to those serving as the limbs.
name: barbaracle

entry: Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start to act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.
name: barbaracle

entry: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.
name: skrelp

entry: It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution.
name: skrelp

entry: It vanishes into seaweed and remains perfectly still to avoid attacks from large Pokémon. Rotten seaweed is its main food source.
name: skrelp

entry: It drifts in the ocean, blending in with floating seaweed. When other Pokémon come to feast on the seaweed, it feasts on them instead.
name: skrelp

entry: it looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it can blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean and avoid being detected by enemies.
name: skrelp

entry: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.
name: dragalge

entry: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where it live, never to return.
name: dragalge

entry: This vicious Pokémon sprays a poisonous liquid on opponents that come near. For whatever reason, it gets along really well with Dhelmise.
name: dragalge

entry: it uses a poisonous liquid capable of corroding metal to send tankers that enter its territory to the bottom of the sea.
name: dragalge

entry: it generates dragon energy by sticking the plume on its head out above the ocean’s surface and bathing it in sunlight.
name: dragalge

entry: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.
name: clauncher

entry: Through controlled explosions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.
name: clauncher

entry: Its claws occasionally fall off, and it keeps a low profile until they grow back. The meat of its claws is so delicious!
name: clauncher

entry: Clauncher’s claws can fall off during battle, but they’ll regenerate. The meat inside the claws is popular as a delicacy in Galar.
name: clauncher

entry: By detonating gas that accumulates in its right claw, this Pokémon launches water like a bullet. This is how it defeats its enemies.
name: clauncher

entry: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.
name: clawitzer

entry: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.
name: clawitzer

entry: It compresses the water it has sucked up and then projects it with enough power to punch a hole right through a thick sheet of iron.
name: clawitzer

entry: After using the feelers on its oversized claw to detect the location of prey, it launches a cannonball of water at its target.
name: clawitzer

entry: Clawitzer’s right arm is a cannon that launches projectiles made of seawater. Shots from a Clawitzer’s cannon arm can sink a tanker.
name: clawitzer

entry: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.
name: helioptile

entry: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.
name: helioptile

entry: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon’s electric moves.
name: helioptile

entry: The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses it to the point of weakness.
name: helioptile

entry: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single it can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
name: heliolisk

entry: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.
name: heliolisk

entry: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when it came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.
name: heliolisk

entry: One it basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.
name: heliolisk

entry: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn’t like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.
name: tyrunt

entry: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up an automobile. It lived 100 million years ago.
name: tyrunt

entry: Its large jaw has incredible destructive power. Some theories suggest that its restored form is different from its form of long ago.
name: tyrunt

entry: This is an ancient Pokémon, revived in modern times. It has a violent disposition, and it’ll tear apart anything it gets between its hefty jaws.
name: tyrunt

entry: This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.
name: tyrunt

entry: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.
name: tyrantrum

entry: Nothing could stop this Pokémon 100 million years ago, so it behaved like a king.
name: tyrantrum

entry: Complete restoration is impossible, allowing room for theories that its entire body was once covered in a feather-like coat.
name: tyrantrum

entry: This Pokémon is from about 100,000,000 years ago. It has the presence of a king, vicious but magnificent.
name: tyrantrum

entry: A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the ancient world.
name: tyrantrum

entry: This ancient Pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.
name: amaura

entry: This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.
name: amaura

entry: It lived in cold areas in ancient times. It’s said that when it whinnies, auroras appear in the night sky.
name: amaura

entry: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. In the past, it lived with others of its kind in cold lands where there were fewer predators.
name: amaura

entry: it is an ancient Pokémon that has gone extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes be found frozen in ice.
name: amaura

entry: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.
name: aurorus

entry: Using its diamond-shaped crystals, it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponent’s attack.
name: aurorus

entry: An it was found frozen solid within a glacier, just as it appeared long ago, which became quite a big event in the news.
name: aurorus

entry: it was restored from a fossil. It’s said that when this Pokémon howls, auroras appear in the night sky.
name: aurorus

entry: When gripped by rage, it will emanate freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.
name: aurorus

entry: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.
name: sylveon

entry: It wraps its ribbonlike feelers around the arm of its beloved Trainer and walks with him or her.
name: sylveon

entry: Its ribbonlike feelers give off an aura that weakens hostility in its prey, causing them to let down their guard. Then it attacks.
name: sylveon

entry: When this Pokémon sights its prey, it swirls its ribbonlike feelers as a distraction. A moment later, it pounces.
name: sylveon

entry: Once a fight breaks out, it will unflinchingly charge at dragon Pokémon that are many times larger than itself.
name: sylveon

entry: By releasing enmity-erasing waves from its ribbonlike feelers, it stops any conflict.
name: sylveon

entry: There’s a Galarian fairy tale that describes a beautiful it vanquishing a dreadful dragon Pokémon.
name: sylveon

entry: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.
name: hawlucha

entry: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.
name: hawlucha

entry: It overwhelms opponents with quick moves, but sometimes it showboats for too long when it’s using a special move and gets itself into a pinch.
name: hawlucha

entry: It drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile maneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy finishing move.
name: hawlucha

entry: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.
name: hawlucha

entry: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.
name: dedenne

entry: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.
name: dedenne

entry: It sneaks into people’s homes and steals electricity from their outlets. When your electric bill seems off, it’s the handiwork of this rascal.
name: dedenne

entry: A Dedenne’s whiskers pick up electrical waves other it send out. These Pokémon share locations of food or electricity with one another.
name: dedenne

entry: Since it can’t generate much electricity on its own, it steals electricity from outlets or other electric Pokémon.
name: dedenne

entry: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
name: carbink

entry: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It’s occasionally found during the excavation of caves.
name: carbink

entry: Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.
name: carbink

entry: Although this Pokémon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.
name: carbink

entry: Some say that deep beneath the surface of the world, a pack of it live with their queen in a kingdom of jewels.
name: carbink

entry: When beset by attackers, it wipes them all out by firing high-energy beams from the gems embedded in its body.
name: carbink

entry: It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.
name: carbink

entry: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn’t dry out.
name: goomy

entry: It’s covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.
name: goomy

entry: The weakest of all Dragon-type Pokémon, it’s unable to breathe if its skin dries out, so it sticks to shady places.
name: goomy

entry: Its source of protection is its slimy, germ-laden mucous membrane. Anyone who touches it needs some thorough hand-washing.
name: goomy

entry: It uses its horns to check out its surroundings. They’re very sensitive, so if you grab them, it will feel a strong shock and be unable to move.
name: goomy

entry: Because most of its body is water, it will dry up if the weather becomes too arid. It’s considered the weakest dragon Pokémon.
name: goomy

entry: Their horns are powerful sensors. As soon as it pick up any sign of enemies, they go into hiding. This is how they’ve survived.
name: goomy

entry: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can’t see anything.
name: sliggoo

entry: Its four horns are a high-performance radar system. It uses them to sense sounds and smells, rather than using ears or a nose.
name: sliggoo

entry: It has trouble drawing a line between friends and food. It will calmly try to melt and eat even those it gets along well with.
name: sliggoo

entry: This Pokémon’s mucous can dissolve anything. Toothless, it sprays mucous on its prey. Once they’re nicely dissolved, it slurps them up.
name: sliggoo

entry: It crawls along sluggishly. The swirly protrusion on its back is filled with its brain and other organs.
name: sliggoo

entry: Although this Pokémon isn’t very strong, its body is coated in a caustic slime that can melt through anything, so predators steer clear of it.
name: sliggoo

entry: The lump on its back contains its tiny brain. It thinks only of food and escaping its enemies.
name: sliggoo

entry: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.
name: goodra

entry: It attacks with retractable horns. It throws a punch that’s the equivalent of the force of a hundred pro boxers.
name: goodra

entry: An amazingly friendly Pokémon, but if left to itself, loneliness overcomes it, and it oozes gooey tears.
name: goodra

entry: It gets picked on because it’s meek. But then, whoever teased it gets to feel the full force of its horns and a good swatting from its thick tail.
name: goodra

entry: It’s very friendly toward people. If you grow close to it, it will hug you with its sticky, slime-covered body. Don’t get mad.
name: goodra

entry: Sometimes it misunderstands instructions and appears dazed or bewildered. Many Trainers don’t mind, finding this behavior to be adorable.
name: goodra

entry: Its form of offense is forcefully stretching out its horns. The strikes land 100 times harder than any blow from a heavyweight boxer.
name: goodra

entry: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.
name: klefki

entry: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.
name: klefki

entry: This even-tempered Pokémon has a habit of collecting keys. It will sneak into people’s homes to steal their keys.
name: klefki

entry: It inserts its horn into chinks in metal, absorbing metal ions. For some reason, it collects keys.
name: klefki

entry: Although it’s unclear why it collects keys, giving it a key makes it very happy. However, it apparently only likes master keys.
name: klefki

entry: This Pokémon is constantly collecting keys. Entrust a it with important keys, and the Pokémon will protect them no matter what.
name: klefki

entry: it sucks in metal ions with the horn topping its head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so much that its head needed to look like one, too.
name: klefki

entry: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.
name: phantump

entry: According to old tales, these Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.
name: phantump

entry: These Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died in the forest. Their cries sound like eerie screams.
name: phantump

entry: According to legend, medicine to cure any illness can be made by plucking the green leaves on its head, brewing them, and boiling down the liquid.
name: phantump

entry: By imitating the voice of a child, it causes people to get hopelessly lost deep in the forest. It’s trying to make friends with them.
name: phantump

entry: After a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit’s rebirth as this Pokémon.
name: phantump

entry: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.
name: phantump

entry: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.
name: trevenant

entry: Using its roots as a nervous system, it controls the trees in the forest. It’s kind to the Pokémon that reside in its body.
name: trevenant

entry: This Pokémon is said to devour anyone daring to ravage the forest. To the creatures dwelling in the forest, it offers great kindness.
name: trevenant

entry: Through its roots, it exerts control over other trees. A deadly curse falls upon anyone cutting down trees in forests where it dwell.
name: trevenant

entry: It’s feared as a ghost of the forest. Lumberjacks bring along Fire types, which it hates, when they enter the forest.
name: trevenant

entry: People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it’s kind.
name: trevenant

entry: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give it control over them.
name: trevenant

entry: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
name: pumpkaboo

entry: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.
name: pumpkaboo

entry: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.
name: gourgeist

entry: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.
name: gourgeist

entry: It blocks opponents’ attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
name: bergmite

entry: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.
name: bergmite

entry: They chill the air around them to −150 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing the water in the air into ice that they use as armor.
name: bergmite

entry: This Pokémon lives in areas of frigid cold. It secures itself to the back of an Avalugg by freezing its feet in place.
name: bergmite

entry: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
name: avalugg

entry: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.
name: avalugg

entry: At high latitudes, this Pokémon can be found with clusters of Bergmite on its back as it swims among the icebergs.
name: avalugg

entry: As it moves about during the day, the cracks in its body deepen. The Pokémon’s body returns to a pristine state overnight.
name: avalugg

entry: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
name: noibat

entry: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.
name: noibat

entry: Fruits are its favorite foods. This gourmet carefully picks out just the ripe ones using its sonar.
name: noibat

entry: After nightfall, they emerge from the caves they nest in during the day. Using their ultrasonic waves, they go on the hunt for ripened fruit.
name: noibat

entry: No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat’s ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.
name: noibat

entry: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.
name: noivern

entry: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.
name: noivern

entry: Although it has a violent disposition, if you give it a nice ripe fruit that it loves, it will suddenly become tame.
name: noivern

entry: Aggressive and cruel, this Pokémon will ruthlessly torment enemies that are helpless in the dark.
name: noivern

entry: Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone. Its fangs finish the fight.
name: noivern

entry: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
name: xerneas

entry: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
name: xerneas

entry: When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
name: yveltal

entry: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.
name: yveltal

entry: When the Kalos region’s ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.
name: zygarde

entry: It’s hypothesized that it’s monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.
name: zygarde

entry: This is Zygarde’s form when it has gathered 50% of its cells. It wipes out all those who oppose it, showing not a shred of mercy.
name: zygarde

entry: It’s thought to be monitoring the ecosystem. There are rumors that even greater power lies hidden within it.
name: zygarde

entry: This is Zygarde’s form when about half of its pieces have been assembled. It plays the role of monitoring the ecosystem.
name: zygarde

entry: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
name: diancie

entry: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
name: diancie

entry: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space.
name: hoopa

entry: It gathers things it likes and passes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.
name: hoopa

entry: In its true form, it possess a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.
name: hoopa

entry: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
name: volcanion

entry: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.
name: volcanion

entry: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.
name: rowlet

entry: Silently it glides, drawing near its targets. Before they even notice it, it begins to pelt them with vicious kicks.
name: rowlet

entry: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.
name: rowlet

entry: At a distance, it launches its sharp feathers while flying about. If the enemy gets too close, it switches tactics and delivers vicious kicks.
name: rowlet

entry: During the day, it builds up energy via photosynthesis. At night, it flies silently through the sky, on the prowl for prey.
name: rowlet

entry: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
name: dartrix

entry: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.
name: dartrix

entry: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don’t groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.
name: dartrix

entry: It throws one knifelike feather after another at its enemies, and each one precisely strikes a weak point. These feathers are known as blade quills.
name: dartrix

entry: It never slacks when it comes to the task of cleaning its feathers. Thorough preening keeps it looking spiffy and its blade quills nice and sharp.
name: dartrix

entry: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.
name: decidueye

entry: Although basically cool and cautious, when it’s caught by surprise, it’s seized by panic.
name: decidueye

entry: It nocks its arrow quills and shoots them at opponents. When it simply can’t afford to miss, it tugs the vine on its head to improve its focus.
name: decidueye

entry: As if wielding a bow, it launches the arrow quills hidden among the feathers of its wings. Decidueye’s shots never miss.
name: decidueye

entry: In a tenth of a second, it can nock and fire an arrow quill, piercing an opponent’s weak point before they notice what’s happening.
name: decidueye

entry: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
name: litten

entry: It doesn’t allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.
name: litten

entry: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won’t open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.
name: litten

entry: It spends even the smallest amount of downtime grooming its fur with its tongue. Loose fur gathers in its stomach and serves as fuel for fiery moves.
name: litten

entry: Trying to pet it before it trusts you will result in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws. Be careful.
name: litten

entry: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.
name: torracat

entry: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.
name: torracat

entry: It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokémon, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer’s whole body covered in scratches.
name: torracat

entry: In the midst of battle, the fire pouch on Torracat’s neck rings like a bell and produces stronger flames than usual.
name: torracat

entry: When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat’s fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell blazes hotter.
name: torracat

entry: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it’s not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer’s orders with complete nonchalance.
name: incineroar

entry: After hurling ferocious punches and flinging furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by spewing fire from around its navel.

entry: Although it’s rough mannered and egotistical, it finds beating down unworthy opponents boring. It gets motivated for stronger opponents.

entry: It excels at violent, no-holds-barred battles. The temperature of the flames that issue from its navel exceeds 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

entry: Incineroar’s rough and aggressive behavior is its most notable trait, but the way it helps out small Pokémon shows that it has a kind side as well.

entry: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It’s famous for being a hard worker.

entry: This Pokémon can control water bubbles. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.

entry: The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.

entry: It creates special bouncy balloons to send at its opponents. When the balloons pop, the sheer force of their bursting is what deals damage.

entry: If it want to create big, powerful balloons, they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for these Pokémon to develop their skills.

entry: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.

entry: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.

entry: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokémon’s Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.

entry: With its mouth, it makes sonic waves that sound like beautiful singing. It uses the sonic waves to control its water balloons.

entry: For Primarina, every battle’s a stage. Its singing and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize the audience.

entry: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.

entry: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.

entry: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.

entry: Although it wasn’t originally found in Alola, this Pokémon was brought over a long time ago when there was a huge Rattata outbreak.

entry: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.

entry: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.

entry: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew fur.

entry: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.

entry: An opponent’s aura can tell it what that opponent’s next move will be. Then it can glide around the attack and strike back.

entry: It’s considered to be a good Pokémon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.

name: rockruff

name: rockruff

name: rockruff

entry: When properly raised from a young age, it will become a trustworthy partner that will absolutely never betray its Trainer.

entry: When it’s in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.

entry: It’s awfully weak and notably tasty, so everyone is always out to get it. As it happens, anyone trying to bully it receives a painful lesson.
